Tucson could never bring himself to do what Hydras was asking of him.  To s=
ave his life by endangering that of another comrade.  And now, given that u=
ltimatum, he still holds firm, determined that if anyone was to give themse=
lves up, for a cause, it would be himself only.  He did not care if he was =
to suffer greatly for his actions, if they saved his comrades it was enough=
 satisfaction for him.  He cared not for power, but cared deeply for those =
who meant the world to him.  Talon, very much so, Lord Elder, Rodimus, and =
all of the Maximals and Autobots he got to know.  No, it was not worth givi=
ng up one of them to save his own life.  He meets Hydras's glare with his o=
wn optics.

"What you ask of me, I can not do.  Although, I will surrender =
myself in Perceptor's stead.  No way in the name of Primus am I going to pu=
t any of my comrades in mortal danger.  If anyone is to meet a dangerous ou=
tcome, I will be willing to take that chance."  

Night Shift looks to Kup =
and Straight Shot.  His gaze quite grim.

" No, it can't end like this.  If=
 he gives himself up, I'm givn' myself up too."

Straight Shot nodds, as sh=
e looks to Talon and Kup.

"And if he gives himself up, I'll give myself up=
 too.  There's no way that lizard creepoid's gonna take one of our own like=
 that."

They step toward Tucson with their hands up, to show no weapons wi=
thin them. Tucson looks to them.

"What are you two doing?"

Night Shift lo=
oks to him.

"Whatever you're don'.  If they take you they gotta take us to=
o. Okay Hydras, you said no prisoners, but we're not gonna let Perceptor go=
.  Instead, we're givn' ourselves up. Besides, a ninjabot's highly prized f=
or their skills."

In a slight moment of pause, a flurecent blue material t=
rickles down Tucson's injured arm, as a drop of that liquid hits the ground=
 with an audible splat, as it disperses, and spatters the ground.  Several =
more drops follow.  It was also apparent that Tucson was faltering a slight=
. A sure sign that he was losing more than just the regular lubricant.

Str=
aight Shot looks down to the puddle and then back to Tucson's heavilly dama=
ged arm.  Yet, he wasn't paying too much attention to it.

"Oh no.  Battery=
 fluid.  If he loses much more than that, he'll go off line for sure."
